text:
I moved so I needed to order checks. It has been about 5-8 years since I have had to get checks. I decided to order through Bradford Exchange Checks. While ordering, I never got a chance to see what my information on the checks would look like, but for the price, it was fine.
I got a receipt $18. Then the next day I got a message that the price had jumped to $39 without my permission because I was a "previous customer."  No clue I was as I used to buy from Checks.com. I replied to the new receipt as soon as I saw it and said to cancel the order. I do not approve of the new charge.

They sent an email back 2 days later saying sorry, your order has already been processed.

What a scam.
title: Charged more without concent

reply.message: Hello Shelli, I am sorry to learn of your experience! Please reach out to us via email at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with the order information or your full address, with a description of the issue so we can assist you! – Anna

text: I ordered checks form these people , they finally get here , the Banks name is wrong , spoke with someone claiming to be a supervisor , she used foul language to me, then hung the phone  up, I immediately called back , the second person was a little more helpful after I threatened to call my bank dispute the charge , then file a complaint with the Consumer Protection Bureau , Ive ordered from these jokers in the past ,and should have learned my lesson , Bad Customer Service, Rude Employees , they should not be in business .
title: I ordered checks form these people

reply.message: Hello, I am very sorry to learn of your experience! Please reach out to us via email at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with the order information or your full address, with a description of the issue so we can look into this for you! -Sadie

text: Buyer Beware! I purchased checks for my father in-law from Bradford Exchange unknowingly they enrolled me in their rewards program and charge me $15.00 a month which got me NOTHING! Trying to cancel the membership is a hassle and they make it difficult. I couldn't access the website, so i had to call in to a 877 number and made me navigate a phone menu which was confusing then I got put on hold for 30 minutes, only to be informed that a supervisor will call me in 24 to 48 hours.
title: Buyer Beware - Didnt know I was enrolled in a Rewards Program!

reply.message: I am sorry for the misunderstanding of our Rewards Program! Please reach out to us via email at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with the order information or your full address, with a description of the issue so we can assist you! – Anna

text: Bradford Exchange Checks offers attractive pricing through their online website or 800 number. BUT at the end of your lengthy order, the price is several 100% higher than what you were initially quoted. My advice is to never do business with a company that operates in so dishonest a fashion.
title: Buyer Beware!

reply.message: Hello, I am sorry for any concerns you have with the billing of your order. Please email us at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with your order information so we can discuss this in more detail. -Rosie

text:
BUYERS BEWARE: This company makes checks. All a person wants are check NOT some service you will never use or know about. I was scammed with a monthly 14.99 fee for 'free shipping'.
THEY FOOL YOU AND ENROLL YOU INTO A The Bradford Exchange Checks Rewards WITHOUT YOUR CONSENT that is misleading and is from a decisively corrupt company that charges you $14.95 per month until you NOTICE their unlawful activity. It took me 6 months. I will be contacting the company and my credit card company and lawyer. DO NOT GET SCAMMED BY THEM.
title: BUYERS BEWARE

reply.message: Hello, I am sorry for any concerns regarding The Bradford Exchange Rewards Program. Please email us at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with your order information so we can discuss this in more detail. -Rosie

text:
I was scammed with a monthly 14.99 fee for some service I did not order or know of, after orderign their checks. Upon calling them, they said it was for a service that I agreed on, when I chose free shipping! Bradford's ad clearly said 'Free Shipping'. No, it did not say free shipping for 14.99 a month until cancelled.
This should be reported to FTC.
title: I was scammed with a monthly 14.99 fee for 'free shipping'!

reply.message: Hello Mathew, I am sorry for the misunderstanding about our Rewards Program! Please reach out to us via email at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with the order information or your full address, with a description of the issue so we can assist you! –Lucy

text: FALSE ADVERTISING!  Checks are advertised at $8.49 per box, and that is the price that appears throughout the purchasing process, but the price becomes $24.00 plus change at the END of the process. Then they add $10.00 handling and more than $10.00 shipping plus another amount for some kind of check protection service. By the time you are done, it costs more than $70.00 for ONE box of checks! Toward the end of the process, I got notice that they recognized me as a valuable customer, and that is about the time the price was suddenly JACKED UP.  I do not remember ordering from them. It must have been years ago. Bottom line is that you can order from them ONCE, but never again because the pricing is OUTRAGEOUS after the first order.  The first order is the only one where they honor the prices they advertise all over the internet.
title: FALSE ADVERTISING

reply.message: Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent order. If you are in need of any assistance, please email us at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with your order information. -Rosie

text:
Bradford exchange used to have quality checks. I received the same checks that I had ordered before, and the printing was actually over top of other printing so that it could not be easily read. The checks were almost falling out of the holder instead of having to be pulled out. When I asked them (including 2 supervisors), I was told repeatedly, that they changed printers and they could not ask the new printer to do the job correctly. When I asked them why they could not ask the printer to do a professional job, the answer was "we can't ask them"!! Since Bradford Exchange Checks now wants it's customers to accept unprofessional printing quality, the customers need to help them make the right decisions by not purchasing any checks, until they realize that the customers deserve to get professional results when they pay them for orders.

They responded with a "I'm sorry, please email us so we can look into this", but that was simply an attempt to make it look like they cared, to the public. There was absolutely no response at all, including from management which was what they were supposed to do. Three different supervisors all had the same "we can't do anything to make our checks look professional because we selected a different printer, so our customers will simply have to be satisfied"!
title: Bradford exchange used to have quality…

reply.message: Hello, I am sorry to hear of this experience! Please email us at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with your order information so we can look in to this further. -Rosie

text: Ordered checks 1 1/2 months ago. Nothing. Called today and was told they sent email cancelling bc I sent a picture of my check with info? Never received the email and when I spoke to the customer service person she was persistent then hung up. I have to spend more time now to see if I was charged. Unbelievable. Horrible company.
title: Ordered checks 1 1/2 months ago

reply.message: Hello Cheryl, I'm sorry to learn about your experience but would like to assist you. Please reach out to us via email at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with the order information or your full address, with a recap of the issue so we can assist you! -Lucy

text:
This is a scam business, they underhandedly put you on a membership program that you don't signup for.  I was charged again for 14.95. BE WARNED, the price they advertise is not what you pay ... the final price is as much as ordering through your bank $20+.  Also, I had to call them and argue with them to have this charge removed, they kept insisting I signed up and was sent an email ... they blatantly lied ... no such email was sent.  I will have to call my bank to have the card canceled and wait a week to get a new one.
UNDERHANDED SCAM COMPANY!
title: This is a scam business

reply.message: Hello Rob, I'm sorry to learn about your experience but would like to assist you. Please reach out to us via email at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with the order information or your full address, with a recap of the issue so we can assist you! -Lucy

text: In February I ordered a set of checks for around $9.00 and a book of address labels. Paid with a debit card which was used on 2/28 to deduct the total amount due. On 3/8, 4/5. and 5/5 they deducted $14.95 each time. When I called they said I chose free shipping which automatically signs you up for rewards program. When I talked to customer service she said she would send me an email to opt out of Rewards program. I said I wanted out and a full refund. She hung up on me !!!!. If I don't get refund I will be filing a complaint with Indiana Attorney General. This is out and out fraud !  No where does it say free shipping enrolls you in a Rewards program. !!!
title: BEWARE !!! If you opt for free shipping they charge you $ 14.95 a month !!!!

reply.message: Hello Kim, I am very sorry to learn of your experience! If you are in need of assistance, please reach out to us via email at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with the order information or your full address, with a description of the issue so we can assist you! -Sadie

text: Terrible customer service. Didn't receive my checks after 3 weeks so i tried going back online to check status and all they gave me was an order number, it wont let you check on that, wants an account number which i didnt have, tried calling, was on hold for 30 minutes with no answer so i hung up. I then faxed them and never got any response.  I then emailed to no reply there either.  I finally called again and it was busy and i pressed the option to have them call me back, i finally got a response !
title: Terrible customer service

reply.message: I am sorry to learn of your experience! Please reach out to us via email at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with the order information or your full address, with a description of the issue so we can assist you! – Anna

text: SCAM! CHARGED 14.95 this month for "Bradford Rewards," on my credit card, and I called to investigate the apparent "continuing charge per month." I was told that I signed a trial offer when I bought the checks, and that I did not cancel the trial offer. I did not knowingly enter any continuing charge agreement with Bradford, as I very carefully avoid all continuing charge agreements, which should be made criminal under consumer protection law unless printed in all capitals, red ink. Regardless, there was no offer to reverse or reimburse the charges for zero services given since the checks were ordered.
title: Questionable monthly billing for no service

reply.message: I am sorry for the misunderstanding of our Rewards Program! Please reach out to us via email at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with the order information or your full address, with a description of the issue so we can assist you! – Anna

text: Tried reordering checks online. Their website wouldn't accept CVC numbers so I called them. First, he can back with an amount $25 more than the website. Then, he insisted on charging me for "phone orders." After telling him five times that their website was broken and I could NOT order online, he argued with me - a customer - and said I would have to pay the phone order charge. I demanded a supervisor. Here's the great part:  He refused. Flat out refused to let me talk to a supervisor UNTIL I gave him my card number. Seriously. And its all recorded (so they say) so they can pedal all the BS they want...worst customer service ever.
title: Save yourself -order somewhere else

reply.message: Hello, i am sorry for any troubles you experienced with placing your order. If you are in need of any assistance or wish to discuss this in more detail, please email us at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with your order information. -Rosie

text: Ordered checks online, when they came my account number at the bottom the check was wrong, ib know I put the right number in, called them twice and like everyone else said they wouldn't do anything about it, seems like this happens a lot, must be how they get their money, I will never buy anything from them again and I plan on reporting them to the BBB

text: I ordered some checks and got an email saying I would be billed $14.95 per month.  I can't log into the website because I don't have a password.  The site will not allow a password reset because it won't send an email.  I called to cancel and the rep said she would send an email...  never got any emails.  Do you see a pattern here?  Better beware.  I will never, ever order anything from them again.  What a ripoff and a hassle.  It looks like I will have to cancel my credit card to get rid of them.

I have been a loyal company for over twenty years and I am disgusted with your company not stepping up and helping me with this issue - you should all be so embarresed to work for a company that is a complete scam.

text:
What a pathetic scam! They offer 4 boxes of checks for $11.85 with free shipping, but when the order is placed, they charge you over $50. AVOID!

Assist in what? You advertise your product for a specific price in your mailer, then you add extra charges that are not mentioned in your mailer. That's fraud.
title: Pathetic scam!

reply.message: Hello Alex, I am very sorry to learn of your experience! If you are in need of assistance, please reach out to us via email at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with the order information or your full address, with a description of the issue so we can assist you! -Sadie

text: I saw the great price offer. Had a total just over $21. They charged my account over $61. When I called, they said it was because I was not a new customer. Evidentially I got checks from them over 16 years ago. They did not adjust the price before I put my credit card information in. I didn't see the adjusted price until I got their email. Upon calling, they offered no adjustment. Other companies at least say (before you place the order) "oops, you aren't a first-time customer." Very disappointed.
title: Don't fall for come-on prices.

reply.message: Hello, I am sorry for any concerns you have with the billing of your order. Please email us at customer_inquiry@bgeltd.com with your order information if you are in need of any assistance. -Rosie
